column1: The dataset used for this project contains 769 rows and 9 columns that represent various health metrics relevant to diabetes risk assessment. These features are known to influence the likelihood of diabetes in patients. The data is commonly used in machine learning to train models for predicting whether a person is likely to develop diabetes.
Glucose:Plasma glucose concentration after a 2-hour oral glucose tolerance test.

column2: a measure of body fat based on height and weight.

column1: DiabetesPedigreeFunction: A function that estimates diabetes risk based on family history (genetic predisposition).
Target variable that indicates whether the patient has diabetes:
Objective: To predict the Outcome (whether a patient has diabetes) based on the given health metrics.
